au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikJoint3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikJoint3D

  • public class FabrikJoint3D
extends Object
    A joint used to constrain the relative angle between FabrikBone3D objects in an IK chain.

    There are three types of joint available:

    • JointType.BALL - A joint which may rotate up to a given angle with regard to the previous bone in the chain or with regard to a global absolute direction in the case of the base bone,
    • JointType.GLOBAL_HINGE - A joint which acts as a hinge, only allowing rotation about a globally specified axis, and
    • JointType.LOCAL_HINGE - A joint which acts as a hinge, only allowing rotation about a locally specified axis (that is, rotation about an axis relative to the current bones direction).
    Ball joints are free to rotate in any direction relative to the direction of the previous bone in the chain. Setting the constraint angle to 180 degrees allows full freedom, whilst a constraint angle of 0 degrees will fully constrain the bone to the direction of the previous bone.

    Hinge joints can rotate in both clockwise and anti-clockwise directions within the valid constraint angles of 0..180 degrees. A global hinge is constrained to rotate about a global axis, while a local hinge is constrained about an axis relative to the bone being constrained.

    Each FabrikBone3D contains precisely one FabrikJoint3D object, which does not have a specific location, but can be considered to be attached to the mStartLocation of the bone. That a bone only contains a single joint may seem unintuitive at first, as when you think about bones in your arms or legs, most bones are connected at two points i.e. with a connection at each end. However, if you imagine working from a blank slate and adding a single bone to an IK chain, then that first bone has a single joint at its base (i.e. start location) and there is no joint at it's tip (i.e. end location).

    Following on from this, adding a second bone to the chain adds with it a second joint, which again can be thought of as being located at the start location of that second bone (which itself is at the end location of the first bone). In this way we avoid having redundant joints (i.e. 2 bones? 4 joints!), and by using the joint of the outer bone to constrain any inner bone during the FABRIK algorithm's 'forward pass', and the bone's own joint when traversing the IK chain during the 'backward pass', the correct constraints are enforced between the relative angles of any pair of adjacent bones.

    Version:
    0.4 - 29/12/2015

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static float MAX_CONSTRAINT_ANGLE_DEGS
      The maximum valid constraint angle for a joint is 180 degrees - this will allow the bone complete freedom to rotate.
      static float MIN_CONSTRAINT_ANGLE_DEGS
      The minimum valid constraint angle for a joint is 0 degrees - this will fully constrain the bone.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FabrikJoint3D

        public FabrikJoint3D()
        Default constructor.

        By default, a FabrikJoint3D cannot be used until the type of joint that it represents has been specified. This may be done via the setAsBallJoint(float), setAsGlobalHinge(au.edu.federation.caliko.utils.Vec3f, float, float, Vec3f) or setAsLocalHinge(au.edu.federation.caliko.utils.Vec3f, float, float, Vec3f) methods.

      • FabrikJoint3D

        public FabrikJoint3D(FabrikJoint3D source)
        Copy constructor.

        Performs a deep copy / clone of the source object so that there are no shared references between the objects after the new object has been constructed.

        Parameters:
        source - The FabrikJoint3D object to copy.

      • clone

        public FabrikJoint3D clone(FabrikJoint3D source)
        Method to clone a FabrikJoint3D.

        Internally, this uses the copy constructor FabrikJoint3D(FabrikJoint3D) to perform the clone.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The cloned FabrikJoint3D.

        public void set(FabrikJoint3D source)
        Set this joint to have the same properties as the proided 'source' joint.
        Parameters:

      • setAsBallJoint

        public void setAsBallJoint(float constraintAngleDegs)
        Set this joint to be a ball joint.
        Parameters:
        constraintAngleDegs - The maximum allowable angle in degrees between this bone and the previous bone in the chain.

      • setHinge

        public void setHinge(FabrikJoint3D.JointType jointType,
                     Vec3f rotationAxis,
                     float clockwiseConstraintDegs,
                     float anticlockwiseConstraintDegs,
                     Vec3f referenceAxis)
        Specify this joint to be a hinge with the provided settings.
        Parameters:
        jointType - The type of joint, this may be either BALL, GLOBAL_HINGE or LOCAL_HINGE.
        rotationAxis - The rotation axis of the hinge.
        clockwiseConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle about the reference axis.
        anticlockwiseConstraintDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle about the reference axis.
        referenceAxis - The reference axis itself, which must fall within the plane of the hinge rotation axis.

      • setAsGlobalHinge

        public void setAsGlobalHinge(Vec3f globalRotationAxis,
                             float cwConstraintDegs,
                             float acwConstraintDegs,
                             Vec3f globalReferenceAxis)
        Make this FabrikJoint3D a global hinge joint - that is, a hinge which rotates around a global / world-space axis.

        Once performed, the hinge is considered initialised and ready for use.

        Providing a zero vec3f for any axis, or constraint angles outside the range 0..180 degrees results in an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        globalRotationAxis - The global / world-space axis about which the hinge allows rotation.
        cwConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        acwConstraintDegs - The anti-clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        globalReferenceAxis - The initial axis around the globalHingeRotationAxis which we will enforce rotational constraints.

      • setAsLocalHinge

        public void setAsLocalHinge(Vec3f localRotationAxis,
                            float cwConstraintDegs,
                            float acwConstraintDegs,
                            Vec3f localReferenceAxis)
        Make this FabrikJoint3D a local hinge joint - that is, a hinge which rotates around an axis relative to the bone to which it is attached.

        Once performed, the hinge is considered initialised and ready for use.

        Providing a zero vec3f for any axis, or constraint angles outside the range 0..180 degrees results in an IllegalArgumentException.

        Parameters:
        localRotationAxis - The local (i.e. previous bone direction relative) axis about which the hinge allows rotation.
        cwConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        acwConstraintDegs - The anti-clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        localReferenceAxis - The initial axis around the localRotationAxis which we will enforce rotational constraints.

      • getHingeClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public float getHingeClockwiseConstraintDegs()
        Get the clockwise constraint angle of a local or global hinge joint.

        If the joint is of type JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.

      • getHingeAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

        public float getHingeAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs()
        Get the anti-clockwise constraint angle of a local or global hinge joint.

        If the joint is of type JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        The anti-clockwise constraint angle in degrees.

      • setBallJointConstraintDegs

        public void setBallJointConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the rotor constraint angle of a ball joint.

        If the angle is outside of the range 0.0f..180.0f then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint is not of type JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The rotor constraint angle in degrees.

      • getBallJointConstraintDegs

        public float getBallJointConstraintDegs()
        Get the rotor constraint angle of a ball joint.

        If the joint is not of type JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        The rotor constraint angle in degrees.

      • setHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setHingeJointClockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the clockwise constraint angle of a hinge joint.

        If the angle is outside of the range 0.0f..180.0f then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint is of type JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The clockwise hinge constraint angle in degrees.

      • setHingeJointAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setHingeJointAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the anit-clockwise constraint angle of a hinge joint.

        If the angle is outside of the range 0.0f..180.0f then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the joint is of type JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The anti-clockwise hinge constraint angle in degrees.

      • setHingeRotationAxis

        public void setHingeRotationAxis(Vec3f axis)
        Set the hinge rotation axis as a normalised version of the provided axis.

        If a zero axis is specifed then an InvalidArgument exception is thrown. If the joint type is JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        axis - The axis which the hinge rotates about.

      • getHingeReferenceAxis

        public Vec3f getHingeReferenceAxis()
        Return the hinge reference axis, which is the direction about which hinge rotation is measured.

        If the joint type is BALL (i.e. not a hinge) then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        The hinge reference axis vector.

      • setHingeReferenceAxis

        public void setHingeReferenceAxis(Vec3f referenceAxis)
        Set the hinge reference axis, which is the direction about which the hinge rotation is measured.

        If a zero axis is specifed then an InvalidArgument exception is thrown. If the joint type is JointType.BALL then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        referenceAxis - The reference axis about which hinge rotation is measured.

      • getHingeRotationAxis

        public Vec3f getHingeRotationAxis()
        Return the hinge rotation axis.

        If the joint type is JointType.BALL (i.e. not a hinge) then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Returns:
        The hinge rotation axis vector.

      • getJointType

        public FabrikJoint3D.JointType getJointType()
        Return the type of this joint.

        This may be JointType.BALL, JointType.GLOBAL_HINGE or JointType.LOCAL_HINGE.

        Returns:
        The type of this joint.
